text:

These are thieves and crooks of the highest order.   Now I’m out over $3,000 in losses because of the incompetence of the Grailed team.  

I operate call centers across multiple industries.  A team of 20-30 well trained monkeys could do a better job then the current team.  I mean it is beyond me the abhorrent nature of this company, just toxic.  You can tell that this is a company of young people without proper business experience and without any real training.  The systems, algorithms and protocols this company has is a complete joke and it’s shocking to me how they have made it so far.  I guess it’s the fact that they do have a lot of rare items,  but that is the sellers that are special, not the platform.  

I implore you to STAY AWAY from this company at all cost.

author: Y Fong
text:
I purchased a sweater that was 'digitally authenticated' by Grailed. The pics and description looks legit (the seller said that he bought them from the local Neimans Marcus), but turns out the US XS-sized sweater (marketed and sold as XS sweater) is actually clearly a knockoff sweater from China (I found a hidden XL label). Aside from this super obvious proof, the material and smell of the sweater is completely off as I am very familiar with these Chinese knockoff sweaters. For people who don't know, many XL labelled Asian-sized Chinese knockoff sweaters fit like a US XS,S,M etc. depending on the item.

So, with the solid proof of a tagged XL label, I sent many photos to the customer support team (the person who responded to me had the first name Kevin) to inform them that this item is 100% not authentic. However, after several days, they simply got back to me, saying that it is authentic. When I asked them repeatedly how do they explain the XL tag (I get they can't really tell things like material from the photos), there was ZERO answer on that, and they kept avoiding that question with zero sense of responsibility. There was no explanation why they stand by it being authentic.

This incident makes me think, if even with a SOLID 100% photographed proofs with the XL tag, they can't even do their job right and take stern action, how would they be able to tell other fake items apart, that are made without obvious flaws that cannot be photographed such as this?

Long story short, Grailed "authentication services" and "zero tolerance policy on fake items" is complete nonsense. I am sharing this story here so buyers and consumers can be more aware and think twice before using Grailed. Seems to me that Grailed is just being completely irresponsible, lazy, and don't want to deal with issues like these. And know this, Grailed, by being complacent and lazy, you ARE supporting counterfeit goods.

TLDR: Grailed is a scamming company that support counterfeit goods. Their "digital authentication" and "zero tolerance policy" towards fake product is complete BS. Don't use them.
title: Grailed (scam site) digitally authenticated a 100% fake item I purchased, then refused to take action after customer support is contacted
